page.title: 06CACKLE STREET, NUTLEY
page.content: My riding instructor lives at Hole Farm in the Nutley part of Ashdown Forest. Sometimes I ride on the forest with her. She has two ponies of her own and the rest are at livery. She keeps ducks and geese as well as horses and has made some lakes containing Golden Orfe and trout. She puts different varieties of water lilies in the lakes. She has also made some dams. They have quite a big farm with a lot of land. The stables are well made from dark brown wood. The indoor riding school is quite big which is good because there is space for cantering. She also gives Pony Club lessons.
